extractions.reasoning: 8 is the size in bytes of a double; using a named constant (or sizeof(double)) avoids brittle assumptions about type size and clarifies allocation intent.
This scale factor determines how input data are initialized; naming it documents the initialization policy and eases tuning.
This is the Bessel's correction (n - 1) used for an unbiased covariance estimate; naming it conveys the statistical intent.
256 is the X-dimension (threads per block) used for the mean kernel launch and scheduling; a named constant documents the launch configuration and centralizes tuning.
This is the X-dimension of the block used for the reduce/cov kernels; naming it clarifies the launch geometry and enables consistent updates.
This is the Y-dimension of the block for reduce/cov kernels; a named constant explains its role and allows easy tuning.
12 is the byte size of the dim3-like struct (3 x uint32_t); naming it (or using sizeof) prevents errors if the struct changes and documents the copy size.
Defines the buffer size for the print format string; a named constant documents intent and avoids magic sizes tied to a literal.
Defines the buffer size for the newline string (including terminator); naming clarifies why the array has length 2.
